title: Documents and bodycam footage for case BA490599

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Documents and bodycam footage for case BA490599
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all unedited/unredacted (if possible) bodycam footage and 911 calls related to the case of Daystar Peterson (BA490599). Please include transcripts of the calls and bodycam footage if available. One particular call is of great public interest: the call from Sean Kelly, the only independent eyewitness in this case. The public has not heard that call, nor have we seen the transcript of it. Other calls from witnesses who were not eyewitnesses have been released publicly. I would also like the original police reports associated with the case as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dana T.

title: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Flock Safety search audits and data sharing
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records related to the agency’s Flock Safety system:
1. Organization Audit in Flock.
 The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the earliest date possible and to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

3. A list of share settings that include:
3.1 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data, also referred to as "Networks that I’m sharing."
3.2 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data, also referred to as "Flock networks shared with me."
3.3 The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists that I’m sharing."
3.4 The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hotlist” information, also referred to as "Hotlists shared with me."

Please provide any documents in their original electronic, machine readable format. For example, please provide csv or spreadsheet files where applicable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

A

See attached screenshot of the Transcript of Ron Serio's Day 1 Testimony in the United States v. Bongiovanni (W.D.N.Y. 2019) Docket Number: 1:19-cr-00227 Date Filed: October 31st, 2019 Assigned To: Lawrence Joseph Vilardo. BiFulco was a prominent Buffalo LCN family member. See: https://buffalonews.com/obituaries/frank-butch-bifulco-75-reputed-mobster-with-a-brilliant-mind/article_1165f678-1ab8-11eb-a55c-130105cb65b9. See Also: https://buffalonews.newspapers.com/article/the-buffalo-news-frank-bifulco-obituary/165163991/

 Please include any and all references to Frank "Butchie" BiFulco.

Mob

title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

title: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property (Vermont State Police)

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: August 2022 Records Request Multi-Agency Response to Stamford, VT Property (Vermont State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records from the Vermont State Police and the Vermont Attorney General’s Office concerning the investigation and resolution involving an Ezra M. Miller’s property in Stamford, Vermont in August 2022, as chronicled in the Rolling Stone article titled 'The Ezra Miller Saga Now Involves Vermont’s Child Services Department' (published August 10, 2022, available at: https://web.archive.org/web/20241215093133/https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/culture-news/ezra-miller-vermont-child-services-department-1392572/). 
The article details attempts by Vermont State Police to serve an emergency care order on August 6, 7, and 9, 2022, at Miller’s 96-acre farm, intended to remove a 25-year-old mother and her three children amid supposed welfare concerns, with oversight by the Vermont Department for Children and Families (DCF) and potential involvement of the Vermont Attorney General’s Office in legal proceedings. 
Most notably, the article includes information or statements attributed to the Attorney’s Office suggesting the property owner was attempting to "evade" or "shield" someone.


Specifically, I seek the following from August 1, 2022, through December 31, 2023:  

- Vermont State Police incident reports, affidavits, dispatch logs, recordings or transcripts of any 911 calls received or made, and bodycam footage related to attempts to serve the emergency care order at Miller’s Stamford property on August 6, 7, and 9, 2022, or in connection with the welfare of the mother and her three children that prompted police responses on those dates; plus any police records documenting subsequent actions or follow-up related to aforementioned alleged child welfare concerns at the property after August 9, 2022.  

- Vermont Attorney General’s Office correspondence (e.g., emails, memos, letters, documents, etc) with Vermont State Police or DCF regarding the emergency care order, its execution, or its resolution; legal opinions or memoranda concerning its enforcement; and any court filings, hearing records, or notices related to the emergency care order or to additional later hearings (referenced in the Rolling Stone article) scheduled on or after August 10, 2022.  

- Any relevant correspondence between Vermont State Police and the Vermont Attorney General’s Office concerning the welfare of the mother and her three children or the execution of the emergency care order. if any responsive records are held by DCF or even out-of-state agencies, I request coordination with that agency or referral of my request to ensure relevant obtainable documents are obtained.

I request that any exempt personal information (e.g., names of minors or private individuals) be redacted rather than withholding documents entirely, consistent with the Vermont Public Records Act’s presumption of disclosure (1 V.S.A. § 315 et seq.).
I am not affiliated with any news agencies & this request is not being made for commercial purposes. This inquiry serves the public interest by shedding light on the resolution of a widely publicized matter (yet for some reason never followed up on by news organizations) involving child welfare and inter-agency action, fostering transparency in governmental proceedings, and discouraging vigilante justice from members of the public who, due to rampant disinformation by omission, might be inclined to take matters into their own hands against a perceived child abductor.  

If there are any issues with the scope or specificity of this request, please contact me to discuss it before denying or delaying the response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PJ

communications.subject: City of Portage, MI - Records Request Confirmation Public Safety Record Request - PS-2025-200
communications.communication:
Thank you for submitting a request for public records to the City of Portage, MI.  Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq.  Your request was received in this office on Thursday, February 27, 2025 and given the reference number Request Number: PS-2025-200 for tracking purposes.  Please have this reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume of documents and any costs associated with satisfying your request.  You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The Michigan Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), MCL 15.231 et seq,  does not require a governmental body to create new information, do legal research, or answer questions. 
  
 The City of Portage has 5 days to respond to this request.  If additional time to process your request is needed, you will be contacted by the City of Portage office responsible for responding to your request. 
  
 If your request was for Public Safety (Police/Fire) Records, please contact the Public Safety office at FOIA-PublicSafety@portagemi.gov or by calling (269) 329-4568.  If your request was for General City Records (or Environmental Site Assessment Info), please contact the Office of the City Clerk at cityclerk@portagemi.gov or by calling (269) 329-4511.

Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions.

communications.subject: Open Public Records Act Request :: W031603-022725
communications.communication:
Steffani Lon  
 
 Custodian of Records  Telephone: (856) 225 – 2131 
 Camden County Administration   
 520 Market Street, 8th Floor 
 Camden, NJ 08102-1375 
Dear Marc  Howard: 
 
Thank you for submitting an Open Public Records request with Camden County. Your request was given the reference number W031603-022725 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
Our office will forward your request to the appropriate Department for their review and search of their files for the requested records. A written response will be sent to you within seven business days or sooner depending on the type of records requested. 
 
 
Please note that day one of the calculation begins the day after the custodian receives your OPRA request. This calculation applies to the agency’s actual business days of operations which are 8:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. If the agency is closed for a Holiday, this date does not count towards the seven business day deadline. Any request received after the close of business will be deemed received on the next business day. 
 
You may monitor the progress of your request at the link below. Additionally, you will receive an email from our office to inform you when your request has been completed and a response is posted at the below link. 
 
Again, thank you for using the Open Public Records Center. 
 
 
Open Public Records Center - http://www.camdencounty.com/open-public-records-opra/ 
 
Steffani Lon 
Custodian of Records

title: Permits database

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Permits database
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

The database of all hunting licenses issued in Pennsylvania from January 1, 2024 to December 31, 2024, including all non-exempt columns and tables of the database. 

We request these records in their native digital formats and not in formats that degrade the accessibility of the records, such as tabular data converted to PDF or Word files. If converting the native digital format to another high-fidelity format, such as CSV or Excel, please take care not to introduce formatting inconsistencies or errors, which can occur in the conversion process (for example, encoding errors or the inclusion of internal unescaped quotation marks in CSV files). Should the records above represent certain values as numeric codes or abbreviations that are not self-explanatory, we additionally request all records necessary to interpret those codes and abbreviations.

Fee Waiver Request:
A waiver of search and review fees is appropriate here because disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii) and 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(a), (b)(1)-(2), and because the request is not primarily in our commercial interest, 45 C.F.R. §§ 5.45(a), (b)(3)(ii).

This Request is Not Primarily in Our Commercial Interest:
The requested information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(a). We are news media requesters that can and will “effectively convey information to the public.” 45 C.F.R. § 5.54(b)(2)(ii).

Production of Responsive Records on a Rolling Basis:
In the event that a portion of the present request is completed before the full request is completed, we ask that the records be produced on a rolling basis.

Limitation of Fees:
We are also entitled to a limitation of fees because we are members of the news media. 45 C.F.R. § 5.53(b); 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). Accordingly, even if our application for a waiver of all fees is denied, we are entitled to a limitation of fees. As a news media requester, we are“entitled to search time, review time, and up to 100 pages of duplication” and can be charged only duplication fees after the first 100 pages or its cost equivalent. 45 C.F.R. § 5.53(b). We request that the information be provided in its native electronic format, and thus there should be no duplication fees.

Request for Explanation of Withholdings and Redactions:
If this request is denied in whole or in part, please provide a reasonable description of any withheld materials and a justification for all such withholdings that includes reference to the specific FOIA exemptions authorizing withholding and specific reasons why such exemptions apply. 45 C.F.R. § 5.31. An agency shall withhold information only if “the agency reasonably foresees that disclosure would harm an interest protected by an exemption” or “disclosure is prohibited by law.” 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(8)(A)(i). (Per Attorney General Garland’s March 15, 2022 memorandum, “In case of doubt [regarding foreseeable harm or legal bar to disclosure], openness should prevail.”We therefore request that if the agency determines that an exemption applies, specific reasons be provided as to why disclosure would harm any interest protected by such exemption. An agency shall also “consider whether partial disclosure of information is possible whenever the agency determines that a full disclosure of a requested record is not possible” and “take reasonable steps necessary to segregate and release nonexempt information.” Id. at § 552(a)(8)(A)(ii). We therefore request that the agency release all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: RE: [External] Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Permits database
communications.communication:
To whom it may concern,

Requests for records under the RTKL must be made on the Office of Open Records (OOR) Standard Right-to-Know Law Request Form.  A PDF copy can be found here<https://www.openrecords.pa.gov/Documents/RTKL/RTKRequestForm.pdf>.  The Pennsylvania Game Commission (PGC) will not act upon requests for records outside the OOR's Standard Form.  The PGC adopts this policy pursuant to Section 504(a) of the Right-to-Know Law, 65 §§ P.S. 67.101-67.3104 (RTKL).  Please fill out the Standard Right-to-Know Law Request Form and resubmit your request.  You can find the PGC's Right-to-Know Law Policy here<https://www.pa.gov/services/pgc/submit-a-right-to-know-request.html>.

Sincerely,

Zachary Fahnestock
Agency Open Records Officer
Office of Chief Counsel
Pennsylvania Game Commission
2001 Elmerton Avenue
Harrisburg, PA 17110

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on 02/20/2025

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on 02/20/2025
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: 02/20/2025
Location: High Pines neighborhood, Miami-Dade County, FL
Suspect: Tykwon Anderson, 20
Incident Summary: Deputies arrested Anderson in connection with a burglary at the home of University of Miami quarterback Carson Beck. Anderson and three others allegedly broke in around 2:45 a.m., stole a garage opener from a white Range Rover, and used it to enter the residence, where they took vehicle key fobs. Surveillance footage captured the stolen vehicles leaving the neighborhood. Bodycam footage reportedly includes interactions with both Beck and his girlfriend, Hanna Cavinder, as well as the arrest of Anderson.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the burglary and theft.
Arrested Tykwon Anderson.
Interacted with Carson Beck and Hanna Cavinder.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Amira Fox - 20th Circuit State's Attorney - Criminal information - State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns your office's litigation in 2 appeals.  Huminski v. State, 2d19-1914 & 2d19-1247, Florida 2 DCA, Ashley Moody, esq.  Trial court, State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815, Lee County Court.  See below,

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law please supply;

    1. Any document filed in the Lee County Court in 2017 that contains a criminal statute relied upon by the State of Florida to achieve plaintiff status and standing in State v. Huminski and the 
        2 related  appeals litigated by your office (2d19-1247, 2d19-1914).  Such a document is supportive of your legitimate participation as Appellee in the 2 appeals.

    2. Absent a document specified in paragraph 1, please supply any document supporting the party status as Plaintiff in State v. Huminski that provided standing concerning  the State of 
         Florida in State v. Huminski (a jurisdictional requirement).

    4. In the absence of any of the above documents, please supply any document, recording, emails, letters, invoices, financial records, medical records, employment files, police reports, 
         photographs, text messages, and any other relevant documents/materials concerning the Statutory basis for the State of Florida's participation in State v. Huminski as a criminal plaintiff.

(See attached .pdf files)

Related supportive links,
Florida Ethics Commission complaints,

          https://www.indybay.org/newsitems/2024/11/25/18871016.php

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/merge_notary_thru_mailing.pdf

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/12/04/amira_final_merge_comp.pdf

          https://www.change.org/p/gov-desantis-remove-state-s-attorney-amira-fox-corruption-official-crime

To aid the reply to this document request, the printed case 2D19-1914 can be found at the below links,

          https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

          https://web.archive.org/web/20201005171650/https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

          https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/record_on_appeal_2019-1914_comp64mb.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Montgomery County Police Records 
 
Dear Harun Harun: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Montgomery County Police Department. Your request was received in this office on 2/27/2025 and given the reference number R091124-022725 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Maryland Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 20, 2024
Location: Montgomery County, Maryland
Suspect: Karen Huger, 61
Incident Summary: Huger was arrested for DUI after crashing her Maserati into a median and two signs. Reports indicate she was highly intoxicated, appeared incoherent, and made unusual statements to officers on scene. Bodycam footage from her arrest was later released, showing her referring to herself as "Thomas Jefferson's concubine" and claiming she was "extremely intelligent." She was charged with DUI, DWI, and reckless driving.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the scene of Huger’s crash.
Conducted any field sobriety tests or questioning.
Placed her under arrest and transported her to detention.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on March 25, 2024

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Arrest on March 25, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: March 25, 2024
Location: Walmart, Palm Coast, Florida
Suspect: Amber McCann, 30
Incident Summary: Deputies responded to a call about a shoplifter at Walmart in Palm Coast. The suspect, Amber McCann, was seen passing all points of sale without paying for over $1,030 worth of merchandise. She fled on foot but was later located. Upon questioning, she admitted to the theft. A search of her vehicle led to the discovery of stolen goods, marijuana, drug paraphernalia, and a locked bag containing methamphetamine and alprazolam. A further search uncovered four bags containing 62 grams of methamphetamine. McCann was arrested and charged with multiple offenses, including grand theft, possession of narcotics, and trafficking methamphetamine.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the Walmart for the shoplifting complaint.
Made contact with Amber McCann.
Conducted the search of her vehicle and found the narcotics.
Transported her to the Sheriff Perry Hall Inmate Detention Facility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: Request for Body Cam Footage of Walgreens Shoplifting Incident on April 29, 2024

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Request for Body Cam Footage of Walgreens Shoplifting Incident on April 29, 2024
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Incident Details for Footage Retrieval:

Date: April 29, 2024
Location: Walgreens, Seattle, WA
Suspects: Unnamed 20-year-old female and 40-year-old male
Incident Summary: The two suspects attempted to steal a cash register from a Walgreens store but were confronted by Seattle police officers as they exited. The female suspect was immediately detained, while the male suspect attempted to flee and hide before being arrested. Officers also discovered a handgun on the female suspect, leading to additional charges. The male suspect was later booked on obstructing a law enforcement officer and is reportedly facing additional charges related to a domestic violence incident.
I am requesting copies of all body-worn camera footage from officers who:

Responded to the incident at Walgreens.
Interacted with and detained the female suspect.
Pursued, arrested, and processed the male suspect.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Harun

title: FL DOS Corp - Centurion + Sullivan Brothers

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FL DOS Corp - Centurion + Sullivan Brothers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I hereby request access to the following public records:

1. All filings, regulatory review documents, correspondence, and internal communications related to the acquisition of Centurion Equity, Inc. by the Sullivan Brothers Family of Companies.

2. Any records indicating state involvement, oversight, or awareness of this transaction, including but not limited to:
a. Communications with regulatory agencies, legal counsel, or corporate officers.
b. Compliance reviews, due diligence assessments, or state approval documents.
c. Meeting notes or internal discussions regarding the implications of the acquisition.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDFs or native digital formats, if available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I request a waiver of any associated fees under Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, as the requested documents serve the public interest by promoting government transparency and corporate accountability. These records are intended for broad public dissemination and are not for commercial purposes. However, if fees are unavoidable, please provide an estimate before fulfilling the request.

As required under Florida law, I anticipate your response within 10 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

Sincerely,

Ashley Burson

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: FLDOC + Gov Ofc (Executive Office of the Governor of Florida)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I hereby request access to the following public records:

All communications, including emails, memos, meeting notes, reports, and directives, exchanged between the Florida Department of Corrections (FDC) and the Office of the Governor from January 1, 2018, to the present, regarding:

1. The "privatization strategy" for Florida’s prison healthcare system.
2. The criteria, selection process, and decision-making factors for awarding healthcare contracts.
3. Any references to "Centurion"  | "Centene" | or any Sullivan Brother Family-owned company, including Sullivan Brother Investments.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDFs, native digital files, or email exports, if available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I request a waiver of any associated fees under Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, as the requested documents serve the public interest by contributing to transparency and accountability in government operations. These records are intended for broad public dissemination and not for commercial use. However, if fees are unavoidable, please provide an estimate before fulfilling the request.

As required under Florida law, I expect a response within a reasonable timeframe, not exceeding 10 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

title: 2023 Centurion Health + FLDOC Contract

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: 2023 Centurion Health + FLDOC Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I respectfully request access to the following public records:

1. All emails, memos, meeting minutes, and related internal communications from January 2022 to the date of this request concerning the negotiation, decision-making, and awarding of the healthcare contract to Centurion of Florida, LLC. 

This includes but is not limited to communications involving the Florida Department of Corrections (FDC) Secretary, procurement officers, legal counsel (not privileged), and other officials involved in contract deliberations. Please also be sure to include records related to:

a. Cost comparisons with previous healthcare providers
b. Performance evaluations of Centurion or other bidders
c. Concerns raised about the privatization process

2.  All internal audit reports, risk assessments, cost–benefit analyses, policy documents, and consultant reports used to justify or guide the awarding of the Centurion contract. This includes documents discussing alternative providers, service quality concerns, financial assessments, or anticipated cost savings.

3.  All records of internal complaints, whistleblower reports, investigations, or disciplinary actions related to medical neglect, staffing shortages, or administrative deficiencies within Florida’s prison healthcare system, specifically mentioning Centurion of Florida, LLC, or any other private healthcare provider under state contract.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDF or native digital format, when available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I also request a waiver of any fees associated with fulfilling this request, as the requested documents are in the public interest and intended for broad public dissemination, not for commercial purposes. However, if fees are unavoidable, please inform me of the estimated cost before proceeding.

As per Florida’s public records law, I anticipate your response within 10 business days. Thank you for your time and cooperation. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Ashley Burson

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Hagerman settlement
communications.communication:
This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on February 26, 2025. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, February 27, 2025.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before March 20, 2025.

Your request is being handled by Ivars Steins. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Ivars Steins at Steinsi@detroitmi.gov<mailto:Steinsi@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

This email serves as the City of Detroit’s response to the above-referenced matter. Your request was received at the City of Detroit Law Department Freedom of Information Act Section via facsimile or email, on February 26, 2025. Because your request was received by electronic transmission, pursuant to Section 5(1) of the Michigan Freedom of Information Act (the “Act”), MCL 15.235(1); it is deemed to have been received at the Law Department on the next business day, February 27, 2025.

Pursuant to Section 5(2) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2), the City’s response is due within five (5) business days. However, due to the nature and the scope of your request and the volume of the requests received by the City, we are extending the City’s response deadline by ten (10) additional business days in accordance with Section 5(2) (d) of the Act, MCL 15.235(2) (d). Therefore, your request will be granted, denied, or granted in part and denied in part on or before March 20, 2025.

Your request is being handled by Sonia Eckerman. If you have questions regarding your request, or if you did not provide an email address in your request, please forward it to Sonia Eckerman at Sonia.eckerman@detroitmi.gov<mailto:Sonia.eckerman@detroitmi.gov> to provide you a response more readily than by regular mail or fax. Mail and fax are not preferred at this time since they both require in-office support. We thank you in advance for your understanding.

title: Settlement with Kefallinos

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Settlement with Kefallinos
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The consent agreement between the City of Detroit and Dennis Kefallinos resolving various nuisance lawsuits filed by the city. The agreement was approved by City Council on Feb. 25.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aaron Mondry

title: NFLIS Reports on Deoxymethoxetamine (3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE, DMXE, 3D-MXE)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NFLIS Reports on Deoxymethoxetamine (3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE, DMXE, 3D-MXE)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request is for the release of any drug reports compiled by the NFLIS (National Forensic Laboratory Information System) regarding Deoxymethoxetamine (3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE, DMXE, 3D-MXE).

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deoxymethoxetamine

According to the September 2024 NFLIS-Drug bulletin, Deoxymethoxetamine was reported by a lab in the state Maryland to the National Forensic Laboratory Information System for the first time in 2024. The drug, publicly identified by the government as a hallucinogen, was reported to the DEA's NFLIS sometime between January 1st 2024 and September 30th 2024. A copy of the September 2024 NFLIS-Drug bulletin that mentions Deoxmethoxetamine should be attached to this request. 

This is a request for any documents, reports, memorandum, or anything that could reasonably be construed as "relevant documents" related to Deoxmethoxetamine created by the NFLIS during this period. Please conduct a search any "evaluations for scheduling" or "recommendations for scheduling" or "reports to NFLIS" or "reports from NFLIS" regarding Deoxymethoxetamine aka "3'-methyl-2-oxo-PCE", "DMXE" and "3D-MXE".

If the Drug Enforcement Agency cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed.

Thank you for the Drug Enforcement Agency's commitment to transparency, and I look forward to working together until this request is resolved.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
